The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Restless Legs Syndrome.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Restless Legs Syndrome (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Tramadol
Pharmacologic class: Full Opioid Agonists
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Albuminuria, Amblyopia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Angina pectoris, Angina unstable

Compound name: Ropinirole
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Acidosis, Pancreatitis acute, Adenocarcinoma, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Albuminuria, Alopecia

Compound name: Carbidopa
Pharmacologic class: DOPA Decarboxylase Inhibitors
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Angioedema, Anorexia, Anxiety, Asthenia, Ataxia

Compound name: Clonidine
Pharmacologic class: Adrenergic alpha2-Agonists
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Aggression, Alopecia, Angioedema, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia, Asthenia, Asthma

Compound name: Pramipexole
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal neoplasm, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Acute tonsillitis, Adenocarcinoma, Adenoma benign, Aggression, Respiratory alkalosis, Alopecia

Compound name: Pregabalin
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Acidosis, Lactic acidosis, Adenoma benign, Adrenal insufficiency, Aggression, Albuminuria, Alopecia

Compound name: Carbamazepine
Pharmacologic class: Decreased Central Nervous System Disorganized Electrical Activity
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Adams-Stokes syndrome, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia

Compound name: L-DOPA
Pharmacologic class: DOPA Decarboxylase Inhibitors
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Angina pectoris, Angioedema, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia

Compound name: Clonazepam
Pharmacologic class: Benzodiazepines
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Aggression, Airway obstruction NOS, Alcohol intoxication, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anger, Angioedema

Compound name: Gabapentin
Pharmacologic class: Decreased Central Nervous System Disorganized Electrical Activity
Effect on Restless Legs Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Alopecia

entities.name: RESTLESS LEGS SYNDROME
entities.description: Restless Legs Syndrome is a disease characterized by an uncontrollable urge to move the legs, often accompanied by uncomfortable sensations, and is associated with various symptoms affecting sleep and muscle function.

entities.name: DISORDERS OF EXCESSIVE SOMNOLENCE
entities.description: Disorders of Excessive Somnolence are conditions that lead to excessive sleepiness and can impact daily functioning.

entities.name: SLEEP INITIATION AND MAINTENANCE DISORDERS
entities.description: Sleep Initiation and Maintenance Disorders refer to difficulties in falling asleep or staying asleep, affecting overall sleep quality.

entities.name: MUSCLE CRAMP
entities.description: Muscle Cramp is a sudden, involuntary contraction of a muscle, often causing pain and discomfort.

entities.name: MYOCLONUS
entities.description: Myoclonus is a neurological condition characterized by sudden, brief involuntary muscle jerks.

entities.name: PARESTHESIA
entities.description: Paresthesia refers to abnormal sensations in the skin, such as tingling or prickling, often described as "pins and needles."

entities.name: PHANTOM LIMB
entities.description: Phantom Limb is a phenomenon where individuals experience sensations, including pain, in a limb that has been amputated.

entities.name: SLEEP APNEA SYNDROMES
entities.description: Sleep Apnea Syndromes are sleep disorders characterized by repeated interruptions in breathing during sleep.

entities.name: SLEEP DISORDERS
entities.description: Sleep Disorders encompass a range of conditions that affect the ability to sleep well on a regular basis.

entities.name: SNORING
entities.description: Snoring is a common condition that occurs when airflow through the mouth and nose is partially obstructed during sleep.

entities.name: PERIPHERAL NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Peripheral Nervous System is a part of the nervous system that connects the central nervous system to the limbs and organs.

entities.name: APPENDAGE
entities.description: Appendage refers to a limb or other body part that is attached to the main body, such as arms and legs.

entities.name: BRAIN
entities.description: The Brain is the central organ of the nervous system, responsible for processing sensory information and coordinating bodily functions.

entities.name: LEG
entities.description: The Leg is a limb of the human body that is used for locomotion and support.

entities.name: NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Nervous System is a complex network of nerves and cells that transmit signals between different parts of the body.

entities.name: CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Central Nervous System consists of the brain and spinal cord, controlling most functions of the body and mind.

entities.name: NERVE
entities.description: Nerve refers to a bundle of fibers that transmits impulses of sensation to the brain or spinal cord.

entities.name: ARM
entities.description: The Arm is a limb of the human body that extends from the shoulder to the wrist, used for manipulation and interaction with the environment.

entities.name: HINDLIMB
entities.description: Hindlimb refers to the back limb of an animal or human, typically used for locomotion.

entities.name: SPINAL CORD
entities.description:
The Spinal Cord is a long, thin bundle of nervous tissue that extends from the brain and transmits signals to and from the body.)<|COMPLETE|>
The Spinal Cord is a long, thin bundle of nervous tissue that extends from the brain and transmits signals to and from the body.

entities.name: TRAMADOL
entities.description: Tramadol is a medication classified as a Full Opioid Agonist, used to palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome but has various side effects.

entities.name: ROPINIROLE
entities.description: Ropinirole is a medication that is used to palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, with a range of potential side effects.

entities.name: CARBIDOPA
entities.description: Carbidopa is a DOPA Decarboxylase Inhibitor used to palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, associated with several side effects.

entities.name: CLONIDINE
entities.description: Clonidine is an Adrenergic alpha2-Agonist that can palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, but may cause various side effects.

entities.name: PRAMIPEXOLE
entities.description: Pramipexole is a medication used to palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, with potential side effects.

entities.name: PREGABALIN
entities.description: Pregabalin is a medication that can palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, associated with various side effects.

entities.name: CARBAMAZEPINE
entities.description: Carbamazepine is a medication that helps palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, with a range of side effects.

entities.name: L-DOPA
entities.description: L-DOPA is a DOPA Decarboxylase Inhibitor used to palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: CLONAZEPAM
entities.description: Clonazepam is a Benzodiazepine that can palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, but has several side effects.

entities.name: GABAPENTIN
entities.description: Gabapentin is a medication that can palliate symptoms of Restless Legs Syndrome, associated with various side effects.

entities.name: GABAPENTIN
entities.description: Gabapentin is a compound used to treat Restless Legs Syndrome and is classified under the pharmacologic class that decreases disorganized electrical activity in the central nervous system.

entities.name: RESTLESS LEGS SYNDROME
entities.description: Restless Legs Syndrome is a condition that Gabapentin aims to palliate, characterized by an uncontrollable urge to move the legs.

entities.name: SIDE EFFECTS
entities.description: Side effects associated with Gabapentin include abdominal pain, aggression, airway obstruction, and several others.

entities.name: AGGRESSION
entities.description: Aggression is a side effect that may occur with the use of Gabapentin.

entities.name: AIRWAY OBSTRUCTION NOS
entities.description: Airway obstruction NOS is a potential side effect of Gabapentin treatment.

entities.name: ALCOHOL INTOXICATION
entities.description: Alcohol intoxication is listed as a side effect that may be associated with Gabapentin.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a side effect that can occur with the use of Gabapentin.

entities.name: AMNESIA
entities.description: Amnesia is a side effect that may be experienced by patients taking Gabapentin.

entities.name: ANAPHYLACTIC SHOCK
entities.description: Anaphylactic shock is a severe side effect that can occur with Gabapentin usage.

entities.name: ANAEMIA
entities.description: Anaemia is a side effect that may be associated with the use of Gabapentin.

entities.name: ANGER
entities.description: Anger is a potential side effect of Gabapentin treatment.

entities.name: ANGIOEDEMA
entities.description: Angioedema is a side effect that can occur with the use of Gabapentin.

entities.name: AMBLYOPIA
entities.description: Amblyopia is a side effect that may be associated with Gabapentin.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description: Amenorrhoea is a potential side effect of Gabapentin treatment.

entities.name: ANALGESIC
entities.description: Gabapentin is often classified as an analgesic due to its pain-relieving properties.

entities.name: ANGINA PECTORIS
entities.description: Angina pectoris is a side effect that may occur with the use of Gabapentin.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Gestational Diabetes.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Gestational Diabetes: Palliate or Treat

These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Gestational Diabetes (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Glyburide
Pharmacologic class: Sulfonylurea Compounds
Effect on Gestational Diabetes: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Lactic acidosis, Agranulocytosis, Alcoholism, Alopecia, Anaemia, Aplastic anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Angioedema

entities.name: GESTATIONAL DIABETES
entities.description: Gestational Diabetes is a type of disease that affects pregnant women, characterized by high blood sugar levels that can lead to various complications during pregnancy and childbirth.

entities.name: BIRTH WEIGHT
entities.description: Birth Weight is a symptom associated with Gestational Diabetes, indicating the weight of the newborn at the time of birth.

entities.name: FETAL HYPOXIA
entities.description: Fetal Hypoxia is a condition where the fetus does not receive enough oxygen, which can be a symptom of Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: FETAL DISTRESS
entities.description: Fetal Distress refers to signs that the fetus is not well, often linked to complications from Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: FETAL MACROSOMIA
entities.description: Fetal Macrosomia is a condition where the fetus is larger than average, often associated with Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: WEIGHT GAIN
entities.description: Weight Gain is a symptom that can occur in pregnant women with Gestational Diabetes, often exceeding normal expectations.

entities.name: FETAL WEIGHT
entities.description: Fetal Weight refers to the weight of the fetus during pregnancy, which can be affected by Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: OVERWEIGHT
entities.description: Overweight is a condition that can be a symptom or risk factor for developing Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: ISLET OF LANGERHANS
entities.description: The Islet of Langerhans is a region of the pancreas that plays a crucial role in insulin production, which is significant in the context of Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: HEAD
entities.description: The Head is a part of the human body where various symptoms of Gestational Diabetes may localize.

entities.name: EMBRYO
entities.description: The Embryo is the early stage of development in pregnancy, where Gestational Diabetes can have significant effects.

entities.name: UTERUS
entities.description: The Uterus is the organ in which the fetus develops, and it is a critical site affected by Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: VAGINA
entities.description: The Vagina is part of the female reproductive system that may be affected by Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: ADIPOSE TISSUE
entities.description: Adipose Tissue is body fat that can influence insulin sensitivity and is relevant in the context of Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: CLAVICLE BONE
entities.description: The Clavicle Bone is a part of the skeletal system that may be referenced in the context of fetal development affected by Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: UMBILICAL ARTERY
entities.description: The Umbilical Artery is a blood vessel that carries blood from the fetus to the placenta, and its function can be impacted by Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: BRACHIAL ARTERY
entities.description: The Brachial Artery is a major blood vessel in the arm that may be referenced in the context of maternal health during Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: SHOULDER
entities.description: The Shoulder is a part of the human body that may be referenced in relation to fetal positioning and development affected by Gestational Diabetes.

entities.name: GLYBURIDE
entities.description: Glyburide is a medication classified as a Sulfonylurea Compound, used to treat Gestational Diabetes by lowering blood sugar levels.

</node>    <node id="CLAVICLE BONE">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Clavicle Bone is a part of the skeletal system that may be referenced in the context of fetal development affected by Gestational Diabetes.</data>      <data key="d2">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="UMBILICAL ARTERY">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Umbilical Artery is a blood vessel that carries blood from the fetus to the placenta, and its function can be impacted by Gestational Diabetes.</data>      <data key="d2">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="BRACHIAL ARTERY">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Brachial Artery is a major blood vessel in the arm that may be referenced in the context of maternal health during Gestational Diabetes.</data>      <data key="d2">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="SHOULDER">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Shoulder is a part of the human body that may be referenced in relation to fetal positioning and development affected by Gestational Diabetes.</data>      <data key="d2">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="GLYBURIDE">      <data key="d0">PERSON</data>      <data key="d1">Glyburide is a medication classified as a Sulfonylurea Compound, used to treat Gestational Diabetes by lowering blood sugar levels.</data>      <data key="d2">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>      <data key="d3">PERSON</data>    </node>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="BIRTH WEIGHT">      <data key="d4">14.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes can lead to complications that affect the Birth Weight of the newborn</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="FETAL HYPOXIA">      <data key="d4">14.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes can cause Fetal Hypoxia due to insufficient oxygen supply to the fetus</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="FETAL DISTRESS">      <data key="d4">14.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes can result in Fetal Distress, indicating the fetus is not well</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="FETAL MACROSOMIA">      <data key="d4">14.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes is associated with Fetal Macrosomia, where the fetus is larger than average</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="WEIGHT GAIN">      <data key="d4">14.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes can lead to excessive Weight Gain during pregnancy</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="FETAL WEIGHT">      <data key="d4">14.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes can affect the Fetal Weight, leading to potential complications</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="OVERWEIGHT">      <data key="d4">10.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes can be linked to being Overweight, which is a risk factor</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="ISLET OF LANGERHANS">      <data key="d4">16.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes affects insulin production in the Islet of Langerhans</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="UTERUS">      <data key="d4">16.0</data>      <data key="d5">Gestational Diabetes has significant effects on the Uterus during pregnancy</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>    <edge source="GESTATIONAL DIABETES" target="GLYBURIDE">      <data key="d4">2.0</data>      <data key="d5">Glyburide is used to treat Gestational Diabetes by lowering blood sugar levels</data>      <data key="d6">d0b2386ba50d297c79bad70faa998c3f</data>    </edge>  </graph></graphml>

[Alzheimer'S Disease] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Agnosia].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Agraphia].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Alcohol Amnestic Disorder].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Amnesia].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Amnesia, Retrograde].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Anomia].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Olfaction Disorders].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Aphasia].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Aphasia, Broca].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] presents the symptom [Aphasia, Wernicke].
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Parasympathetic Nervous System] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Embryo] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Brain] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Nervous System] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Central Nervous System] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Olfactory Nerve] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Pupil] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Choroid Plexus] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Forebrain] of human body.
[Alzheimer'S Disease] localizes at the [Telencephalon] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Alzheimer'S Disease.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Alzheimer'S Disease (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Selegiline
Pharmacologic class: Monoamine Oxidase-B Inhibitors
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Aggression, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea, Amnesia, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia

Compound name: Benzatropine
Pharmacologic class: Histamine Receptor Antagonists
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Palliate
Side effect: Confusional state, Constipation, Dysphagia, Dermatitis, Dysuria, Rash, Body temperature increased, Heat stroke, Hypersensitivity, Hypoaesthesia

Compound name: Ropinirole
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Acidosis, Pancreatitis acute, Adenocarcinoma, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Albuminuria, Alopecia

Compound name: Quetiapine
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea, Amnesia, Retrograde amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia

Compound name: Haloperidol
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Palliate
Side effect: Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Mental disorder, Breast disorder, Bronchospasm

Compound name: Rivastigmine
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Adams-Stokes syndrome, Adenocarcinoma, Aggression, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaemia, Hypochromic anaemia

Compound name: Galantamine
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Aggression, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Aphasia, Apraxia, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia, Arthritis

Compound name: Memantine
Pharmacologic class: NMDA Receptor Antagonists
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Pancreatitis acute, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia

Compound name: Donepezil
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alzheimer'S Disease: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Aggression, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia

entities.name: ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE
entities.description: Alzheimer's Disease is a type of disease characterized by various symptoms affecting cognitive functions and memory.

entities.name: AGNOSIA
entities.description: Agnosia is a symptom of Alzheimer's Disease that involves the inability to recognize objects, people, sounds, shapes, or smells.

entities.name: AGRAPHIA
entities.description: Agraphia is a symptom of Alzheimer's Disease that refers to the loss of the ability to write.

entities.name: ALCOHOL AMNESTIC DISORDER
entities.description: Alcohol Amnestic Disorder is a symptom associated with Alzheimer's Disease, characterized by memory loss due to alcohol use.

entities.name: AMNESIA
entities.description: Amnesia is a symptom of Alzheimer's Disease that involves memory loss, affecting the ability to recall past experiences.

entities.name: AMNESIA, RETROGRADE
entities.description: Retrograde Amnesia is a type of amnesia where the individual loses memories of events that occurred before the onset of the disease.

entities.name: ANOMIA
entities.description: Anomia is a symptom of Alzheimer's Disease characterized by difficulty in naming objects or recalling words.

entities.name: OLFACTION DISORDERS
entities.description: Olfaction Disorders are symptoms of Alzheimer's Disease that affect the sense of smell.

entities.name: APHASIA
entities.description: Aphasia is a symptom of Alzheimer's Disease that affects communication abilities, including speaking and understanding language.

entities.name: APHASIA, BROCA
entities.description: Broca's Aphasia is a type of aphasia associated with Alzheimer's Disease, characterized by difficulty in speech production.

entities.name: APHASIA, WERNICKE
entities.description: Wernicke's Aphasia is a type of aphasia associated with Alzheimer's Disease, characterized by difficulty in understanding language.

entities.name: PARASYMPATHETIC NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Parasympathetic Nervous System is a part of the human body where Alzheimer's Disease localizes.

entities.name: EMBRYO
entities.description: The Embryo is a stage of human development where Alzheimer's Disease can have effects.

entities.name: BRAIN
entities.description: The Brain is the central organ affected by Alzheimer's Disease, responsible for cognitive functions.

entities.name: NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Nervous System is a complex network in the human body where Alzheimer's Disease has significant impacts.

entities.name: CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Central Nervous System is a critical area in the human body where Alzheimer's Disease localizes.

entities.name: OLFACTORY NERVE
entities.description: The Olfactory Nerve is involved in the sense of smell and is affected by Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: PUPIL
entities.description: The Pupil is a part of the eye that can be influenced by Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: CHOROID PLEXUS
entities.description: The Choroid Plexus is a structure in the brain where Alzheimer's Disease can have effects.

entities.name: FOREBRAIN
entities.description: The Forebrain is a part of the brain that is significantly impacted by Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: TELENCEPHALON
entities.description: The Telencephalon is a region of the brain where Alzheimer's Disease can localize.

entities.name: SELEGILINE
entities.description: Selegiline is a compound classified as a Monoamine Oxidase-B Inhibitor that can palliate Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: BENZATROPINE
entities.description: Benzatropine is a compound classified as a Histamine Receptor Antagonist that can palliate Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: ROPINIROLE
entities.description: Ropinirole is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class that can palliate Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: QUETIAPINE
entities.description: Quetiapine is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class that can palliate Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: HALOPERIDOL
entities.description: Haloperidol is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class that can palliate Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: RIVASTIGMINE
entities.description: Rivastigmine is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class that can treat Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: GALANTAMINE
entities.description: Galantamine is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class that can treat Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: MEMANTINE
entities.description: Memantine is a compound classified as an NMDA Receptor Antagonist that can treat Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: DONEPEZIL
entities.description: Donepezil is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class that can treat Alzheimer's Disease.

entities.name: MEMBRANOUS GLOMERULONEPHRITIS
entities.description: Membranous Glomerulonephritis is a disease characterized by specific symptoms and localizations in the human body.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a symptom associated with Membranous Glomerulonephritis, indicating swelling due to fluid retention.

entities.name: MONOCLONAL GAMMOPATHY OF UNDETERMINED SIGNIFICANCE
entities.description: Monoclonal Gammopathy Of Undetermined Significance is a symptom that can present in patients with Membranous Glomerulonephritis.

entities.name: PROTEINURIA
entities.description: Proteinuria is a symptom of Membranous Glomerulonephritis, characterized by excess protein in the urine.

entities.name: BASAL LAMINA OF EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Basal Lamina Of Epithelium is one of the localizations in the human body affected by Membranous Glomerulonephritis.

entities.name: EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Epithelium is a layer of tissue where Membranous Glomerulonephritis can localize.

entities.name: RENAL VEIN
entities.description: The Renal Vein is another localization in the human body impacted by Membranous Glomerulonephritis.

entities.name: CORTEX OF KIDNEY
entities.description: The Cortex Of Kidney is a region where Membranous Glomerulonephritis can manifest.

entities.name: NEPHRON TUBULE
entities.description: The Nephron Tubule is a part of the kidney where Membranous Glomerulonephritis can localize.

entities.name: KIDNEY
entities.description: The Kidney is the organ where Membranous Glomerulonephritis is localized.

entities.name: PHARMACOLOGIC CLASS
entities.description: The pharmacologic class to which the compound belongs, relevant for its treatment of Membranous Glomerulonephritis.

entities.name: EFFECT ON MEMBRANOUS GLOMERULONEPHRITIS
entities.description: The positive effect of the compound on Membranous Glomerulonephritis, indicating whether it palliates or treats the disease.

entities.name: SIDE EFFECT
entities.description: The side effects associated with the compound used to treat or palliate Membranous Glomerulonephritis.)<|COMPLETE|>

entities.name: PROSTATE CANCER
entities.description: Prostate Cancer is a disease characterized by the uncontrolled growth of prostate cells, presenting various symptoms and localizing in different parts of the human body.

entities.name: ANOXIA
entities.description: Anoxia is a condition characterized by an absence of oxygen in the tissues, which can be a symptom of Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: CONSTIPATION
entities.description: Constipation is a common symptom that can occur in patients with Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: DIARRHEA
entities.description: Diarrhea is a symptom that may present in individuals suffering from Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a condition involving swelling due to fluid retention, which can be a symptom of Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: FATIGUE
entities.description: Fatigue is a common symptom experienced by individuals diagnosed with Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: FEMINIZATION
entities.description: Feminization refers to the development of female characteristics, which can be a symptom associated with Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: FLATULENCE
entities.description: Flatulence is a symptom that may occur in patients with Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: FLUSHING
entities.description: Flushing is a symptom characterized by sudden reddening of the skin, which can be associated with Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: NAUSEA
entities.description: Nausea is a common symptom that can be experienced by individuals with Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: PAIN
entities.description: Pain is a prevalent symptom in patients suffering from Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: LYMPH NODE
entities.description: Lymph Nodes are part of the immune system and can be a localization site for Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: URETER
entities.description: The Ureter is a duct that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder and can be affected by Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: URETHRA
entities.description: The Urethra is the tube that carries urine out of the body and can be a localization site for Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: TESTIS
entities.description: The Testis is a male reproductive organ that can be affected by Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Epithelium is a tissue that can be involved in the localization of Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: PENIS
entities.description: The Penis is a male reproductive organ that can be a localization site for Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: SEMINAL VESICLE
entities.description: The Seminal Vesicle is a gland that can be affected by Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: EJACULATORY DUCT
entities.description: The Ejaculatory Duct is a duct that can be involved in the localization of Prostate Cancer.

entities.name: VAS DEFERENS

entities.name: NILUTAMIDE
entities.description: Nilutamide is a compound classified as an Androgen Receptor Antagonist used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including abdominal pain and alopecia.

entities.name: ESTRADIOL
entities.description: Estradiol is a compound classified as an Estrogen Receptor Agonist used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including abdominal cramps and anaphylactic shock.

entities.name: PREDNISONE
entities.description: Prednisone is a compound classified as a Corticosteroid Hormone Receptor Agonist used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including abdominal distension and adrenal insufficiency.

entities.name: EPIRUBICIN
entities.description: Epirubicin is a compound classified as a Topoisomerase Inhibitor used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including lactic acidosis and agranulocytosis.

entities.name: ESTRONE
entities.description: Estrone is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class mentioned, used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including abdominal cramps and asthma.

entities.name: ETOPOSIDE
entities.description: Etoposide is a compound classified as a Topoisomerase Inhibitor used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including abdominal pain and agranulocytosis.

entities.name: ETHINYL ESTRADIOL
entities.description: Ethinyl Estradiol is a compound classified as an Estrogen Receptor Agonist used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including anxiety and breast disorder.

entities.name: CONJUGATED ESTROGENS
entities.description: Conjugated Estrogens is a compound classified as an Estrogen Receptor Agonist used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including acidosis and anaphylactic shock.

entities.name: ABIRATERONE
entities.description: Abiraterone is a compound with no specific pharmacologic class mentioned, used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including arrhythmia and chest pain.

entities.name: MITOXANTRONE
entities.description: Mitoxantrone is a compound classified as a Topoisomerase Inhibitor used to treat prostate cancer, with side effects including anxiety and arrhythmia.

entities.name: ADENOMA BENIGN
entities.description: Adenoma benign refers to a non-cancerous tumor that can occur in various organs, which may require monitoring or surgical intervention.

entities.name: AGRANULOCYTOSIS
entities.description: Agranulocytosis is a serious condition involving a dangerously low level of neutrophils, increasing the risk of infections and requiring immediate medical attention.

entities.name: ALBUMINURIA
entities.description: Albuminuria is a medical condition characterized by the presence of albumin in the urine, often indicating kidney damage or disease.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a medical condition that results in hair loss, which can be caused by various factors including genetics, illness, or medication.

entities.name: ANAPHYLACTIC SHOCK
entities.description: Anaphylactic shock is a severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that requires immediate medical intervention.

entities.name: ANAEMIA
entities.description: Anaemia is a condition characterized by a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood, leading to fatigue and weakness.

entities.name: APLASTIC ANAEMIA
entities.description: Aplastic anaemia is a rare condition where the bone marrow fails to produce sufficient blood cells, requiring treatment such as blood transfusions or bone marrow transplant.

entities.name: ANGINA PECTORIS
entities.description: Angina pectoris is chest pain or discomfort due to reduced blood flow to the heart, often a symptom of coronary artery disease.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description: Abdominal pain is a common symptom that can arise from various medical conditions affecting the organs in the abdominal cavity.

entities.name: ANOREXIA
entities.description: Anorexia is a condition characterized by a loss of appetite or desire to eat, which can lead to significant weight loss and nutritional deficiencies.

entities.name: ARTHRITIS
entities.description: Arthritis is a term used to describe inflammation of the joints, leading to pain, swelling, and decreased mobility.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description:
Asthenia is a medical term for a condition characterized by a lack of energy and strength, often associated with various illnesses.
Asthenia is a condition characterized by a lack of energy and strength, often associated with various illnesses.

entities.name: BACK PAIN
entities.description: Back pain is a common condition that can result from various causes, including injury, muscle strain, or underlying medical conditions.

entities.name: CHEST PAIN
entities.description: Chest pain is a symptom that can indicate a range of conditions, from minor issues to serious heart problems.

entities.name: CONSTIPATION
entities.description: Constipation is a common digestive issue characterized by infrequent bowel movements and difficulty passing stool.

entities.name: CONGENITAL ANOMALY
entities.description: Congenital anomaly refers to a medical condition that is present at birth, which can affect the structure or function of various organs.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description: Amenorrhoea is the absence of menstruation in a woman of reproductive age, which can be caused by various factors including hormonal imbalances.

entities.name: AMNESIA
entities.description: Amnesia is a condition characterized by memory loss, which can result from injury, illness, or psychological factors.

entities.name: ANXIETY
entities.description: Anxiety is a mental health condition characterized by excessive worry, fear, or nervousness, often affecting daily functioning.

entities.name: ANGIOEDEMA
entities.description: Angioedema is a condition involving swelling of the deeper layers of the skin, often associated with allergic reactions.

entities.name: APNOEA
entities.description: Apnoea is a medical condition characterized by temporary cessation of breathing, often occurring during sleep.

entities.name: ASCITES
entities.description: Ascites is the accumulation of fluid in the abdominal cavity, often due to liver disease or other medical conditions.

entities.name: CONTUSION
entities.description: Contusion is a medical term for a bruise, which occurs when small blood vessels are damaged, leading to bleeding under the skin.

entities.name: COUGH
entities.description: Cough is a reflex action to clear the airways of mucus or foreign irritants, which can be a symptom of various respiratory conditions.)<|COMPLETE|>

entities.name: LEPROSY
entities.description: Leprosy is a chronic infectious disease caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium leprae, characterized by skin lesions and nerve damage.

entities.name: RIFAMPICIN
entities.description: Rifampicin is an antibiotic used to treat leprosy, belonging to the pharmacologic class of Rifamycins.

entities.name: DAPSONE
entities.description: Dapsone is a medication used to treat leprosy, classified as a Sulfone, with various side effects including abdominal pain and renal issues.

entities.name: THALIDOMIDE
entities.description: Thalidomide is a drug used to treat leprosy, known for its immunomodulatory effects and associated with multiple side effects.

entities.name: AGEUSIA
entities.description: Ageusia is a symptom characterized by the loss of taste, which can be associated with leprosy.

entities.name: BLINDNESS
entities.description: Blindness is a symptom that can occur in patients with leprosy due to nerve damage.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a symptom involving swelling caused by fluid retention, which can be present in leprosy patients.

entities.name: EYE MANIFESTATIONS
entities.description: Eye manifestations refer to various eye-related symptoms that can occur in leprosy patients.

entities.name: FACIAL PARALYSIS
entities.description: Facial paralysis is a symptom of leprosy that results from nerve damage affecting facial muscles.

entities.name: FEVER
entities.description: Fever is a common symptom that can occur in leprosy patients as part of the body's response to infection.

entities.name: HYPERESTHESIA
entities.description: Hyperesthesia is a condition of increased sensitivity to sensory stimuli, which can be experienced by leprosy patients.

entities.name: HYPOESTHESIA
entities.description: Hypoesthesia is a condition of reduced sensitivity to sensory stimuli, often seen in leprosy due to nerve damage.

entities.name: MUSCULAR ATROPHY
entities.description: Muscular atrophy refers to the wasting away of muscle tissue, which can occur in leprosy patients due to nerve damage.

entities.name: NEURALGIA
entities.description: Neuralgia is a symptom characterized by sharp pain along the path of a nerve, which can be associated with leprosy.

entities.name: NOSE
entities.description: The nose is a part of the human body where leprosy can localize, leading to deformities and damage.

entities.name: PERIPHERAL NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The peripheral nervous system is affected by leprosy, leading to symptoms such as loss of sensation and muscle weakness.

entities.name: APPENDAGE
entities.description: Appendages, such as hands and feet, can be affected by leprosy, resulting in deformities and loss of function.

entities.name: TENDON
entities.description: Tendons can be impacted by leprosy, leading to complications in movement and function.

entities.name: TESTIS
entities.description: The testis is a part of the human body where leprosy can localize, potentially affecting reproductive health.

entities.name: EYE
entities.description: The eye is a part of the human body that can be affected by leprosy, leading to vision problems.

entities.name: SKIN EPIDERMIS
entities.description: The skin epidermis is the outer layer of skin that is often affected by leprosy, leading to lesions and deformities.

entities.name: NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The nervous system is significantly impacted by leprosy, resulting in various neurological symptoms.

entities.name: NERVE
entities.description: Nerves can be damaged by leprosy, leading to loss of sensation and muscle control.

entities.name: SHEATH OF SCHWANN
entities.description: The sheath of Schwann is a protective covering of nerves that can be affected by leprosy, impacting nerve function.

[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Aerophagy].

[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Dyskinesia, Drug-Induced].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Dystonia].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Echolalia].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Huntington Disease].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Hyperkinesis].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Language Disorders].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] presents the symptom [Learning Disorders].
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] localizes at the [Brain] of human body.

[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] localizes at the [Central Nervous System] of human body.
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] localizes at the [Internal Capsule Of Telencephalon] of human body.
[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] localizes at the [Midbrain] of human body.

[Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome] localizes at the [Autonomic Nervous System] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Pimozide
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Agranulocytosis, Amenorrhoea, Anaemia, Aplastic anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Anorexia, Asthenia, Mental disorder, Breast disorder, Chest pain

Compound name: Olanzapine
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: 

Compound name: Clonidine
Pharmacologic class: Adrenergic alpha2-Agonists
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Aggression, Alopecia, Angioedema, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia, Asthenia, Asthma

Compound name: Mecamylamine
Pharmacologic class: Decreased Autonomic Ganglionic Activity
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Anorexia, Asthenia, Chorea, Constipation, Libido decreased, Dizziness, Fatigue, Fibrosis, Glossitis, Orthostatic hypotension

Compound name: Haloperidol
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Mental disorder, Breast disorder, Bronchospasm

Compound name: Risperidone
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Adenocarcinoma, Adenoma benign, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Albinism, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea

Compound name: Perphenazine
Pharmacologic class: Phenothiazines
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Agranulocytosis, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Haemolytic anaemia, Angioedema, Anorexia, Asphyxia, Asthma, Ataxia, Neurogenic bladder

Compound name: Pergolide
Pharmacologic class: Ergot Alkaloids
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Acute abdomen, Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Acidosis, Adenoma benign, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Amnesia, Anaemia

Compound name: Ziprasidone
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Albuminuria, Respiratory alkalosis, Alopecia, Dementia Alzheimer's type, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea, Amnesia, Anaemia, Hypochromic anaemia

entities.name: GILLES DE LA TOURETTE SYNDROME
entities.description: Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome is a neurological disorder characterized by involuntary tics and other symptoms affecting the nervous system.

entities.name: AEROPHAGY
entities.description: Aerophagy is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by excessive swallowing of air.

entities.name: CATALEPSY
entities.description: Catalepsy is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, involving a trance-like state and muscular rigidity.

entities.name: CHOREA
entities.description: Chorea is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by irregular, unintentional movements.

entities.name: DYKINESIA, DRUG-INDUCED
entities.description: Drug-induced dyskinesia is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, resulting from medication side effects.

entities.name: DYSTONIA
entities.description: Dystonia is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, involving involuntary muscle contractions.

entities.name: ECHOLALIA
entities.description: Echolalia is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by the involuntary repetition of phrases or words.

entities.name: HUNTINGTON DISEASE
entities.description: Huntington Disease is a neurological disorder that can present symptoms similar to those of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome.

entities.name: HYPERKINESIS
entities.description: Hyperkinesis is a symptom associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by excessive movement.

entities.name: LANGUAGE DISORDERS
entities.description: Language disorders are symptoms associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, affecting communication abilities.

entities.name: LEARNING DISORDERS
entities.description: Learning disorders are symptoms associated with Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, impacting educational performance.

entities.name: BRAIN
entities.description: The brain is the organ where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, affecting neurological functions.

entities.name: NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The nervous system is the body system where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, controlling bodily functions and movements.

entities.name: CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The central nervous system is the part of the nervous system where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, including the brain and spinal cord.

entities.name: INTERNAL CAPSULE OF TELENCEPHALON
entities.description: The internal capsule of the telencephalon is a brain structure where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, involved in motor control.

entities.name: MIDBRAIN
entities.description: The midbrain is a part of the brain where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, playing a role in motor movement and auditory processing.

entities.name: CEREBELLAR NUCLEAR COMPLEX
entities.description: The cerebellar nuclear complex is a brain structure where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, involved in coordination and balance.

entities.name: AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The autonomic nervous system is a part of the nervous system where Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome localizes, regulating involuntary bodily functions.

entities.name: PIMOZIDE
entities.description: Pimozide is a compound used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: OLANZAPINE
entities.description: Olanzapine is a compound used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with unspecified side effects.

entities.name: CLONIDINE
entities.description: Clonidine is an adrenergic alpha2-agonist used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with several side effects.

entities.name: MECAMYLAMINE
entities.description: Mecamylamine is a compound used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: HALOPERIDOL
entities.description: Haloperidol is a compound used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: RISPERIDONE
entities.description: Risperidone is a compound used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: PERPHENAZINE
entities.description: Perphenazine is a phenothiazine used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: PERGOLIDE
entities.description: Pergolide is an ergot alkaloid used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: ZIPRASIDONE
entities.description: Ziprasidone is a compound used to palliate symptoms of Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, with various side effects.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description: Amenorrhoea is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by the absence of menstruation.

entities.name: ANAEMIA
entities.description: Anaemia is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a deficiency of red blood cells.

entities.name: APLASTIC ANAEMIA
entities.description: Aplastic anaemia is a rare but serious side effect associated with some compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, involving the failure of the bone marrow to produce blood cells.

entities.name: HAEMOLYTIC ANAEMIA
entities.description: Haemolytic anaemia is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by the destruction of red blood cells.

entities.name: ANOREXIA
entities.description: Anorexia is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a loss of appetite.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description: Asthenia is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a lack of energy or strength.

entities.name: MENTAL DISORDER
entities.description: Mental disorder is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, affecting psychological well-being.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by hair loss.

entities.name: FIBROSIS
entities.description: Fibrosis is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by the thickening and scarring of connective tissue.

entities.name: GLOSSITIS
entities.description: Glossitis is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by inflammation of the tongue.

entities.name: ORTHOSTATIC HYPOTENSION
entities.description: Orthostatic hypotension is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a sudden drop in blood pressure upon standing.

entities.name: ABSCESS

entities.description: Adenocarcinoma is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a type of cancer that forms in mucus-secreting glands.

entities.description: Adenoma benign is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a non-cancerous tumor.

entities.name: ALBINISM
entities.description: Albinism is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a lack of pigment in the skin, hair, and eyes.

entities.name: ATAXIA
entities.description: Ataxia is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by a lack of muscle control or coordination.

entities.description: Neurogenic bladder is a potential side effect associated with several compounds used to palliate Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome, characterized by bladder dysfunction due to nerve damage.

   <data key="d1">Gilles De La Tourette Syndrome is a neurological disorder characterized by involuntary tics and other symptoms affecting the nervous system.</data>      <data entities.name: CELIAC DISEASE
entities.description: Celiac Disease is a medical condition characterized by an immune reaction to gluten, leading to various symptoms and localizations in the human body.

entities.name: ABDOMEN
entities.description: Abdomen is a part of the human body where symptoms of Celiac Disease can manifest.

entities.name: ATAXIA
entities.description: Ataxia is a symptom associated with Celiac Disease, affecting coordination and balance.

entities.name: BODY WEIGHT
entities.description: Body Weight is a symptom that can be affected by Celiac Disease, often leading to weight loss or failure to thrive.

entities.name: CEREBELLAR ATAXIA
entities.description: Cerebellar Ataxia is a specific type of ataxia that can be a symptom of Celiac Disease.

entities.name: CONSTIPATION
entities.description: Constipation is one of the gastrointestinal symptoms that can occur in individuals with Celiac Disease.

entities.name: DIARRHEA
entities.description: Diarrhea is a common symptom of Celiac Disease, often leading to malabsorption of nutrients.

entities.name: DIARRHEA, INFANTILE
entities.description: Infantile Diarrhea is a specific manifestation of diarrhea that can occur in infants with Celiac Disease.

entities.name: DOWN SYNDROME
entities.description: Down Syndrome is a genetic disorder that can present symptoms similar to those of Celiac Disease.

entities.name: DYSPEPSIA
entities.description: Dyspepsia refers to indigestion, which can be a symptom experienced by those with Celiac Disease.

entities.name: FAILURE TO THRIVE
entities.description: Failure to Thrive is a condition often seen in children with Celiac Disease due to malabsorption.

entities.name: BLOOD
entities.description: Blood is one of the localizations in the human body where Celiac Disease can have effects.

entities.name: BASAL LAMINA OF EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Basal Lamina of Epithelium is a layer in the body that can be affected by Celiac Disease.

entities.name: EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Epithelium is a tissue that can be impacted by Celiac Disease, particularly in the digestive system.

entities.name: DIGESTIVE SYSTEM
entities.description: The Digestive System is the primary area affected by Celiac Disease, leading to various gastrointestinal symptoms.

entities.name: URINE
entities.description: Urine is another localization in the human body where effects of Celiac Disease can be observed.

entities.name: SWEAT
entities.description: Sweat is a bodily fluid that can also be affected by Celiac Disease.

entities.name: SMOOTH MUSCLE TISSUE
entities.description: Smooth Muscle Tissue is a type of tissue that can be impacted by Celiac Disease.

entities.name: SUPERIOR MESENTERIC ARTERY
entities.description: The Superior Mesenteric Artery is a blood vessel that can be affected by the symptoms of Celiac Disease.

entities.name: PANCREAS
entities.description: The Pancreas is an organ that can be affected by Celiac Disease, impacting digestion and insulin production.

entities.name: LYMPHOID TISSUE
entities.description: Lymphoid Tissue is part of the immune system that can be influenced by Celiac Disease.

entities.name: ACUTE
entities.description: Acute refers to a condition that comes on suddenly and is severe, often used to describe symptoms related to Celiac Disease.

chunk:
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Amblyopia].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Blindness].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Choroid Hemorrhage].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Color Vision Defects].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Diplopia].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Edema].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Eye Hemorrhage].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Hallucinations].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Night Blindness].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] presents the symptom [Retinal Hemorrhage].
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Macula Lutea] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Basal Lamina Of Epithelium] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Cranial Nerve Ii] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Retina] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Eye] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Ophthalmic Artery] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Central Retinal Artery] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Central Retinal Vein] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Orbit Of Skull] of human body.
[Age Related Macular Degeneration] localizes at the [Iris] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Age Related Macular Degeneration.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Age Related Macular Degeneration: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Age Related Macular Degeneration (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

entities.name: AGE RELATED MACULAR DEGENERATION
entities.description: Age Related Macular Degeneration is a disease characterized by various symptoms affecting vision, including Amblyopia, Blindness, and others, and it localizes in several parts of the human eye and body.

entities.name: AMBLYOPIA
entities.description: Amblyopia is a symptom associated with Age Related Macular Degeneration that results in reduced vision in one eye.

entities.name: BLINDNESS
entities.description: Blindness is a severe symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration that leads to the loss of vision.

entities.name: CHOROID HEMORRHAGE
entities.description: Choroid Hemorrhage is a symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration involving bleeding in the choroid layer of the eye.

entities.name: COLOR VISION DEFECTS
entities.description: Color Vision Defects are symptoms of Age Related Macular Degeneration that affect the ability to perceive colors accurately.

entities.name: DIPLOPIA
entities.description: Diplopia, or double vision, is a symptom associated with Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration characterized by swelling due to fluid accumulation in the eye.

entities.name: EYE HEMORRHAGE
entities.description: Eye Hemorrhage is a symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration involving bleeding within the eye.

entities.name: HALLUCINATIONS
entities.description: Hallucinations can occur as a symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration, affecting visual perception.

entities.name: NIGHT BLINDNESS
entities.description: Night Blindness is a symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration that impairs vision in low-light conditions.

entities.name: RETINAL HEMORRHAGE
entities.description: Retinal Hemorrhage is a symptom of Age Related Macular Degeneration involving bleeding in the retina.

entities.name: MACULA LUTEA
entities.description: The Macula Lutea is a part of the human eye where Age Related Macular Degeneration localizes, crucial for sharp vision.

entities.name: BASAL LAMINA OF EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Basal Lamina of Epithelium is a layer in the human body where Age Related Macular Degeneration can localize.

entities.name: CRANIAL NERVE II
entities.description: Cranial Nerve II, also known as the optic nerve, is involved in the localization of Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: RETINA
entities.description: The Retina is a critical part of the eye where Age Related Macular Degeneration localizes, affecting vision.

entities.name: EYE
entities.description: The Eye is the organ where Age Related Macular Degeneration manifests and localizes.

entities.name: OPHTHALMIC ARTERY
entities.description: The Ophthalmic Artery supplies blood to the eye and is a location related to Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: CENTRAL RETINAL ARTERY
entities.description: The Central Retinal Artery is a blood vessel in the eye that is associated with Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: CENTRAL RETINAL VEIN
entities.description: The Central Retinal Vein is involved in the drainage of blood from the retina and is related to Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: ORBIT OF SKULL
entities.description: The Orbit of Skull is the bony cavity that houses the eye, where Age Related Macular Degeneration can have effects.

entities.name: IRIS
entities.description: The Iris is the colored part of the eye that can be affected by Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: PHARMACOLOGIC CLASS
entities.description: The pharmacologic class to which the compound belongs, indicating its mechanism of action.

entities.name: EFFECT ON AGE RELATED MACULAR DEGENERATION
entities.description: Indicates whether the compound can palliate or treat Age Related Macular Degeneration.

entities.name: SIDE EFFECT
entities.description: The side effects associated with the compound used to treat Age Related Macular Degeneration.)<|COMPLETE|>

chunk:
[Penile Cancer] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Penile Cancer] presents the symptom [Edema].
[Penile Cancer] presents the symptom [Pain].
[Penile Cancer] presents the symptom [Pain, Intractable].
[Penile Cancer] presents the symptom [Cafe-Au-Lait Spots].
[Penile Cancer] presents the symptom [Dysuria].
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Lymph Node] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Urethra] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Penis] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Scrotum] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Sebaceous Gland] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Skin Of Body] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Perineum] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Rectus Abdominis Muscle] of human body.
[Penile Cancer] localizes at the [Clitoris] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Penile Cancer.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Penile Cancer: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Penile Cancer (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

entities.name: PENILE CANCER
entities.description: Penile Cancer is a type of disease characterized by various symptoms and localizations in the human body.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a symptom associated with Penile Cancer, indicating swelling due to fluid retention.

entities.name: PAIN
entities.description: Pain is a symptom that can occur in patients with Penile Cancer, indicating discomfort or suffering.

entities.name: PAIN, INTRACTABLE
entities.description: Intractable Pain is a severe form of pain that is difficult to manage and is associated with Penile Cancer.

entities.name: CAFE-AU-LAIT SPOTS
entities.description: Cafe-Au-Lait Spots are skin manifestations that can be a symptom of Penile Cancer.

entities.name: DYSURIA
entities.description: Dysuria is a symptom characterized by painful urination, which can occur in Penile Cancer patients.

entities.name: LYMPH NODE
entities.description: Lymph Nodes are part of the human body's immune system and can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: URETHRA
entities.description: The Urethra is a tube that carries urine from the bladder and can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: PENIS
entities.description: The Penis is a male reproductive organ and a primary localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: SCROTUM
entities.description: The Scrotum is a pouch of skin containing the testicles and can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: SEBACEOUS GLAND
entities.description: Sebaceous Glands are small glands in the skin that can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: SKIN OF BODY
entities.description: The Skin of the Body can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: PERINEUM
entities.description: The Perineum is the area between the anus and the genitals and can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: RECTUS ABDOMINIS MUSCLE
entities.description: The Rectus Abdominis Muscle is a muscle in the abdomen that can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: CLITORIS
entities.description: The Clitoris is a part of the female anatomy that can be a localization site for Penile Cancer.

entities.name: ILEUM CANCER
entities.description: Ileum Cancer is a type of disease characterized by various symptoms and localizations within the human body.

entities.name: ABDOMEN, ACUTE
entities.description: Abdomen, Acute is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer.

entities.name: DIARRHEA
entities.description:
Diarrhea is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer, characterized by frequent and loose bowel movements.
Diarrhea is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer.

entities.name: FLUSHING
entities.description:
Flushing is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer, characterized by a sudden reddening of the skin, often accompanied by a feeling of warmth.
Flushing is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description:
Abdominal Pain is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer.
Abdominal Pain is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer, indicating discomfort or pain in the stomach area.

entities.name: GASTROPARESIS
entities.description:
Gastroparesis is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer.
Gastroparesis is a symptom associated with Ileum Cancer, characterized by delayed gastric emptying and can lead to nausea and vomiting.

entities.name: LYMPH NODE
entities.description:
Lymph Node is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, involved in the immune response.
Lymph Node is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.

entities.name: URETER
entities.description:
Ureter is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.
Ureter is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, responsible for transporting urine from the kidneys to the bladder.

entities.name: EPITHELIUM
entities.description:
Epithelium is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.
Epithelium is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, serving as a protective layer of cells.

entities.name: SMOOTH MUSCLE TISSUE
entities.description:
Smooth Muscle Tissue is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.
Smooth Muscle Tissue is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, involved in involuntary movements.

entities.name: SUPERIOR MESENTERIC ARTERY
entities.description:
Superior Mesenteric Artery is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, supplying blood to the intestines.
Superior Mesenteric Artery is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.

entities.name: PANCREAS
entities.description:
Pancreas is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, involved in digestion and blood sugar regulation.
Pancreas is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.

entities.name: LYMPHOID TISSUE
entities.description:
Lymphoid Tissue is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body.
Lymphoid Tissue is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, part of the immune system.

entities.description:

Duct Of Salivary Gland is one of the localizations of Ileum Cancer in the human body, involved in saliva secretion.

[Duodenum Cancer] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Abdomen, Acute].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Anorexia].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Colic].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Diarrhea].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Dyspepsia].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Hematemesis].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Jaundice].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Nausea].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Vomiting].
[Duodenum Cancer] presents the symptom [Abdominal Pain].
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Lymph Node] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Digestive System] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Ventral Pancreatic Duct] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Common Bile Duct] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Superior Mesenteric Artery] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Hepatic Artery] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Pancreas] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Celiac Artery] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Bile] of human body.
[Duodenum Cancer] localizes at the [Gastric Juice] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Duodenum Cancer.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Duodenum Cancer: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Duodenum Cancer (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

entities.name: DUODENUM CANCER
entities.description: Duodenum Cancer is a type of disease characterized by various symptoms and localizations within the human body, affecting the digestive system and associated organs.

entities.name: ABDOMEN
entities.description: Abdomen is a part of the human body where symptoms of Duodenum Cancer may manifest.

entities.name: ACUTE
entities.description: Acute is a symptom associated with Duodenum Cancer, indicating a sudden onset of pain or discomfort.

entities.name: ANOREXIA
entities.description: Anorexia is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer characterized by a loss of appetite.

entities.name: COLIC
entities.description: Colic is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer that involves severe, often fluctuating pain in the abdomen.

entities.name: DIARRHEA
entities.description: Diarrhea is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer that involves frequent, loose, or watery bowel movements.

entities.name: DYSPEPSIA
entities.description: Dyspepsia is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer characterized by discomfort or pain in the upper abdomen.

entities.name: HEMATEMESIS
entities.description: Hematemesis is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer involving vomiting blood.

entities.name: JAUNDICE
entities.description: Jaundice is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer characterized by yellowing of the skin and eyes due to bile duct obstruction.

entities.name: NAUSEA
entities.description: Nausea is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer that involves a feeling of sickness with an inclination to vomit.

entities.name: VOMITING
entities.description: Vomiting is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer involving the expulsion of stomach contents through the mouth.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description: Abdominal Pain is a symptom of Duodenum Cancer that indicates discomfort in the stomach area.

entities.name: LYMPH NODE
entities.description: Lymph Node is a localization in the human body where Duodenum Cancer may spread or be affected.

entities.name: DIGESTIVE SYSTEM
entities.description: The Digestive System is a major localization for Duodenum Cancer, where the disease primarily occurs.

entities.name: VENTRAL PANCREATIC DUCT
entities.description: The Ventral Pancreatic Duct is a localization in the human body associated with Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: COMMON BILE DUCT
entities.description: The Common Bile Duct is a localization in the human body that can be affected by Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: SUPERIOR MESENTERIC ARTERY
entities.description: The Superior Mesenteric Artery is a localization in the human body that may be involved in Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: HEPATIC ARTERY
entities.description: The Hepatic Artery is a localization in the human body that can be affected by Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: PANCREAS
entities.description: The Pancreas is a localization in the human body where Duodenum Cancer may occur.

entities.name: CELIAC ARTERY
entities.description: The Celiac Artery is a localization in the human body that may be involved in Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: BILE
entities.description: Bile is a substance in the human body that may be affected by Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: GASTRIC JUICE
entities.description: Gastric Juice is a substance in the human body that may be involved in Duodenum Cancer.

entities.name: PHARMACOLOGIC CLASS
entities.description: The pharmacologic class to which the compound belongs, indicating its category of action.

entities.name: EFFECT ON DUODENUM CANCER
entities.description: The effect of the compound on Duodenum Cancer, indicating whether it palliates or treats the disease.

entities.name: SIDE EFFECT
entities.description: The side effects associated with the compound used for Duodenum Cancer treatment.)<|COMPLETE|>
