[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Birth Weight].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Body Weight].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Bulimia].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Dysmenorrhea].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Hirsutism].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Obesity].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Thinness].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Virilism].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Weight Loss].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] presents the symptom [Overweight].
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Pituitary Gland] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Follicular Fluid] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Embryo] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Endocrine System] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Female Gonad] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Uterus] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Vagina] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Adipose Tissue] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Strand Of Hair] of human body.
[Polycystic Ovary Syndrome] localizes at the [Urine] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Ethinyl Estradiol
Pharmacologic class: Estrogen Receptor Agonists
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Angioedema, Anxiety, Asthenia, Back pain, Mental disorder, Breast disorder

Compound name: Levonorgestrel
Pharmacologic class: Progesterone Congeners
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Acute tonsillitis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaemia, Hypochromic anaemia, Angioedema, Anorexia, Anxiety

Compound name: Drospirenone
Pharmacologic class: Progesterone Congeners
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Mental disorder, Breast disorder, Cerebral infarction, Depression, Embolism, Erythema multiforme, Gastrointestinal disorder, Haemorrhage, Infarction, Breast pain

Compound name: Norethindrone
Pharmacologic class: Progesterone Congeners
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal cramps, Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abortion spontaneous, Adenoma benign, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Anovulation, Asthenia

Compound name: Desogestrel
Pharmacologic class: Progesterone Congeners
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Alopecia, Mental disorder, Breast cancer, Breast disorder, Libido decreased, Dermatitis, Diarrhoea, Erythema multiforme, Erythema nodosum

Compound name: Metformin
Pharmacologic class: Biguanides
Effect on Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Acidosis, Anaemia megaloblastic, Angina pectoris, Angina unstable, Anorexia, Asthenia, Breast disorder, Chest pain

entities.name: POLYCYSTIC OVARY SYNDROME
entities.description: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome is a disease characterized by various symptoms and localizations in the human body, affecting women's reproductive health.

entities.name: BIRTH WEIGHT
entities.description: Birth Weight is a symptom associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating potential health issues related to weight at birth.

entities.name: BODY WEIGHT
entities.description: Body Weight is a symptom associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, reflecting the impact of the disease on an individual's weight.

entities.name: BULIMIA
entities.description: Bulimia is a symptom that can be associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating an eating disorder that may arise due to hormonal imbalances.

entities.name: DYSMENORRHEA
entities.description: Dysmenorrhea is a symptom of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, referring to painful menstruation that affects many women with the condition.

entities.name: HIRSUTISM
entities.description: Hirsutism is a symptom of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome characterized by excessive hair growth in women, often due to hormonal imbalances.

entities.name: OBESITY
entities.description: Obesity is a common symptom of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, often resulting from metabolic issues associated with the disease.

entities.name: THINNESS
entities.description: Thinness can be a symptom of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating that some individuals may experience weight loss due to the condition.

entities.name: VIRILISM
entities.description: Virilism is a symptom of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome that involves the development of male physical characteristics in women due to hormonal imbalances.

entities.name: WEIGHT LOSS
entities.description: Weight Loss is a symptom associated with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, which may occur due to metabolic changes in the body.

entities.name: OVERWEIGHT
entities.description: Overweight is a symptom of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating that many individuals with the condition may struggle with excess weight.

entities.name: PITUITARY GLAND
entities.description: The Pituitary Gland is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, playing a crucial role in hormonal regulation.

entities.name: FOLLICULAR FLUID
entities.description: Follicular Fluid is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, involved in the reproductive processes of women.

entities.name: EMBRYO
entities.description: The Embryo is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating its impact on early stages of human development.

entities.name: ENDOCRINE SYSTEM
entities.description: The Endocrine System is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, as it regulates hormones that affect the condition.

entities.name: FEMALE GONAD
entities.description: The Female Gonad is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, directly involved in female reproductive health.

entities.name: UTERUS
entities.description: The Uterus is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, where many symptoms and effects of the disease manifest.

entities.name: VAGINA
entities.description: The Vagina is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, as it is part of the female reproductive system affected by the disease.

entities.name: ADIPOSE TISSUE
entities.description: Adipose Tissue is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, where fat distribution can be affected by hormonal changes.

entities.name: STRAND OF HAIR
entities.description: Strand Of Hair is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, as hair growth patterns can be influenced by the disease.

entities.name: URINE
entities.description: Urine is a localization point for Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, as it can be analyzed for hormonal levels and metabolic changes.

entities.name: LEVONORGESTREL
entities.description: Levonorgestrel is a compound classified as a Progesterone Congener, used to palliate symptoms of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.name: DROSPIRINONE
entities.description: Drospirenone is a compound classified as a Progesterone Congener, used to palliate symptoms of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.description: Norethindrone is a compound classified as a Progesterone Congener, used to palliate symptoms of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.name: DESOGESTREL
entities.description: Desogestrel is a compound classified as a Progesterone Congener, used to palliate symptoms of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.name: METFORMIN

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description: Abdominal Pain is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating hair loss.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description: Amenorrhoea is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, referring to the absence of menstruation.

entities.name: ANGIOEDEMA
entities.description: Angioedema is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, characterized by swelling beneath the skin.

entities.name: ANXIETY
entities.description: Anxiety is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating psychological distress.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description: Asthenia is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, referring to a lack of energy or strength.

entities.name: BACK PAIN
entities.description: Back Pain is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.name: MENTAL DISORDER
entities.description: Mental Disorder is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating potential psychological effects.

entities.name: BREAST DISORDER
entities.description: Breast Disorder is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating issues related to breast health.

entities.name: CEREBRAL INFARCTION
entities.description: Cerebral Infarction is a serious side effect associated with Drospirenone, indicating a risk of stroke.

entities.name: DEPRESSION
entities.description: Depression is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating mood disorders.

entities.name: EMBOLISM
entities.description: Embolism is a serious side effect associated with Drospirenone, indicating a blockage in a blood vessel.

entities.name: ERYTHEMA MULTIFORME
entities.description: Erythema Multiforme is a side effect associated with Drospirenone, indicating a skin condition that can occur due to medication.

entities.name: GASTROINTESTINAL DISORDER
entities.description: Gastrointestinal Disorder is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, indicating digestive issues.

entities.name: HAEMORRHAGE
entities.description: Haemorrhage is a serious side effect associated with Drospirenone, indicating excessive bleeding.

entities.name: INFARCTION
entities.description: Infarction is a serious side effect associated with Drospirenone, indicating tissue death due to lack of blood supply.

entities.name: BREAST PAIN
entities.description: Breast Pain is a side effect associated with various compounds used to palliate or treat Polycystic Ovary Syndrome.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL CRAMPS
entities.description: Abdominal Cramps is a side effect associated with Norethindrone, indicating discomfort in the abdominal area.

entities.name: ABORTION SPONTANEOUS
entities.description: Abortion Spontaneous is a serious side effect associated with Norethindrone, indicating the risk of miscarriage.

entities.name: ADENOMA BENIGN
entities.description: Adenoma Benign is a side effect associated with Norethindrone, indicating a non-cancerous tumor.

entities.name: ANAPHYLACTIC SHOCK
entities.description: Anaphylactic Shock is a serious side effect associated with Norethindrone, indicating a severe allergic reaction.

entities.name: ANOVULATION
entities.description: Anovulation is a side effect associated with Norethindrone, indicating the absence of ovulation.

entities.name: CHEST PAIN
entities.description: Chest Pain is a side effect associated with Metformin, indicating potential cardiovascular issues.

entities.name: ACIDOSIS
entities.description: Acidosis is a serious side effect associated with Metformin, indicating an imbalance in the body's acid-base levels.

entities.name: ANAEMIA MEGALOBLASTIC
entities.description: Anaemia Megaloblastic is a side effect associated with Metformin, indicating a type of anemia due to vitamin B12 deficiency.

entities.name: ANGINA PECTORIS
entities.description: Angina Pectoris is a side effect associated with Metformin, indicating chest pain due to reduced blood flow to the heart.

entities.name: ANGINA UNSTABLE
entities.description: Angina Unstable is a serious side effect associated with Metformin, indicating a higher risk of heart attack.)<|COMPLETE|>

chunk:
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Anoxia].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Cough].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Dyspnea].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Heartburn].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Respiratory Sounds].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Sleep Apnea Syndromes].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Aging, Premature].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] presents the symptom [Sleep Apnea, Obstructive].
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] localizes at the [Respiratory System] of human body.
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] localizes at the [Pulmonary Artery] of human body.
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] localizes at the [Lung] of human body.
[Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis] localizes at the [Alveolus Of Lung] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Prednisolone
Pharmacologic class: Corticosteroid Hormone Receptor Agonists
Effect on Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abscess, Hyperadrenocorticism, Anaphylactic shock, Angioedema, Arachnoiditis, Arrhythmia, Blister, Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, Conjunctivitis

entities.name: IDIOPATHIC PULMONARY FIBROSIS
entities.description: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis is a disease characterized by progressive scarring of lung tissue, leading to respiratory difficulties and various symptoms.

entities.name: ANOXIA
entities.description: Anoxia is a condition characterized by an absence of oxygen in the tissues, which can be a symptom of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

entities.name: COUGH
entities.description: Cough is a common symptom associated with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis, often resulting from lung irritation.

entities.name: DYSPNEA
entities.description: Dyspnea refers to difficulty in breathing, a prevalent symptom of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

entities.name: HEARTBURN
entities.description: Heartburn is a symptom that may occur in patients with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis, potentially due to related respiratory issues.

entities.name: RESPIRATORY SOUNDS
entities.description: Respiratory sounds are abnormal sounds heard during breathing, which can indicate complications associated with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

entities.name: SLEEP APNEA SYNDROMES
entities.description: Sleep Apnea Syndromes are conditions that can occur in patients with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis, affecting their sleep quality and breathing.

entities.name: AGING, PREMATURE
entities.description: Aging, Premature refers to early onset of aging symptoms, which can be associated with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

entities.name: SLEEP APNEA, OBSTRUCTIVE
entities.description: Obstructive Sleep Apnea is a specific type of sleep apnea that can be a symptom in patients with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

entities.name: RESPIRATORY SYSTEM
entities.description: The Respiratory System is the part of the human body where Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis localizes, affecting breathing and gas exchange.

entities.name: PULMONARY ARTERY
entities.description: The Pulmonary Artery is a major blood vessel that can be affected by Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis, impacting blood flow to the lungs.

entities.name: LUNG
entities.description: The Lung is the primary organ affected by Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis, where scarring and inflammation occur.

entities.name: ALVEOLUS OF LUNG
entities.description: The Alveolus of Lung is the tiny air sac in the lungs where gas exchange occurs, and is significantly impacted by Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

entities.name: PREDNISOLONE
entities.description: Prednisolone is a corticosteroid medication used to palliate symptoms of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis by reducing inflammation in the lungs.

entities.name: CORTICOSTEROID HORMONE RECEPTOR AGONISTS
entities.description: Corticosteroid Hormone Receptor Agonists are a class of drugs that includes Prednisolone, used to treat various inflammatory conditions including Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis.

Compound name: ***

These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Stomach Cancer (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Capecitabine
Pharmacologic class: Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Congenital anomaly, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Angina pectoris, Angina unstable

Compound name: Fluorouracil
Pharmacologic class: Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Congenital anomaly, Abortion spontaneous, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia, Arrhythmia

Compound name: Epirubicin
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Lactic acidosis, Agranulocytosis, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock

Compound name: Methotrexate
Pharmacologic class: Folic Acid Metabolism Inhibitors
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Alveolitis allergic, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Aplastic anaemia, Anaemia megaloblastic, Anorexia

Compound name: Irinotecan
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal cramps, Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia, Arrhythmia, Asthenia

Compound name: Floxuridine
Pharmacologic class: Deoxyuridine
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Aneurysm, Angina pectoris, Anorexia, Asthenia

Compound name: Doxorubicin
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Lactic acidosis, Agranulocytosis, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock

Compound name: Mitomycin
Pharmacologic class: Alkylating Activity
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Alopecia, Anaemia, Anorexia, Asthenia, Confusional state, Cough, Dermatitis, Diarrhoea, Dizziness, Drowsiness

Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Angina unstable, Anorexia, Arrhythmia

Pharmacologic class: Microtubule Inhibition
Effect on Stomach Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Angina unstable, Anorexia, Arrhythmia

entities.name: MICROTUBULE INHIBITION
entities.description: Microtubule Inhibition is a pharmacologic class used in the treatment of stomach cancer.

entities.name: STOMACH CANCER
entities.description: Stomach cancer is a type of cancer that affects the stomach and can be treated with microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description: Abdominal pain is a side effect associated with the treatment of stomach cancer using microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: AGRANULOCYTOSIS
entities.description: Agranulocytosis is a serious side effect that can occur with the use of microtubule inhibitors in stomach cancer treatment.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a side effect that may result from the treatment of stomach cancer with microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description: Amenorrhoea is a potential side effect of microtubule inhibitors used in stomach cancer treatment.

entities.name: ANAPHYLACTIC SHOCK
entities.description: Anaphylactic shock is a severe allergic reaction that can occur as a side effect of microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: ANAEMIA
entities.description: Anaemia is a common side effect associated with the treatment of stomach cancer using microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: ANGINA PECTORIS
entities.description: Angina pectoris is a potential side effect that may arise from the use of microtubule inhibitors in stomach cancer treatment.

entities.name: ANGINA UNSTABLE
entities.description: Unstable angina is a serious side effect that can occur with the use of microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: ANOREXIA
entities.description: Anorexia is a side effect that may be experienced by patients undergoing treatment for stomach cancer with microtubule inhibitors.

entities.name: ARRHYTHMIA
entities.description: Arrhythmia is a potential side effect of microtubule inhibitors used in the treatment of stomach cancer.

[Intracranial Aneurysm] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Alcohol Amnestic Disorder].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Amnesia].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Amnesia, Retrograde].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Olfaction Disorders].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Aphasia].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Blindness].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Brain Death].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Cerebrospinal Fluid Rhinorrhea].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Coma].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] presents the symptom [Confusion].
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Cranial Nerve Ii] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Brain] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Optic Chiasma] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Pons] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [External Carotid Artery] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Radial Artery] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Brachiocephalic Artery] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Common Carotid Artery Plus Branches] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Internal Carotid Artery] of human body.
[Intracranial Aneurysm] localizes at the [Subclavian Artery] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Intracranial Aneurysm.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Intracranial Aneurysm: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Intracranial Aneurysm (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

entities.name: INTRACRANIAL ANEURYSM
entities.description: Intracranial Aneurysm is a type of disease characterized by various symptoms and localizations in the human body.

entities.name: ALCOHOL AMNESTIC DISORDER
entities.description: Alcohol Amnestic Disorder is a symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: AMNESIA
entities.description:
Amnesia is a symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.
Amnesia is a general term for memory loss, which can be a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: AMNESIA, RETROGRADE
entities.description:
Retrograde Amnesia is a specific type of amnesia that is a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.
Retrograde Amnesia is a type of memory loss where individuals cannot recall events that occurred before a specific point in time, and it is a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: OLFACTION DISORDERS
entities.description:
Olfaction Disorders refer to issues with the sense of smell, which can occur as a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.
Olfaction Disorders are symptoms that can occur with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: APHASIA
entities.description:
Aphasia is a language disorder that affects a person's ability to communicate, and it can be a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.
Aphasia is a symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: BLINDNESS
entities.description:
Blindness is the loss of vision, which can be a severe symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.
Blindness is a symptom that can occur due to Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: BRAIN DEATH
entities.description:
Brain Death is the irreversible loss of all functions of the brain, which can be a consequence of severe Intracranial Aneurysm.
Brain Death is a severe outcome that can be associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: CEREBROSPINAL FLUID RHINORRHEA
entities.description:
Cerebrospinal Fluid Rhinorrhea is a condition where cerebrospinal fluid leaks from the nose, which can be a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.
Cerebrospinal Fluid Rhinorrhea is a symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: COMA
entities.description:
Coma is a serious symptom that can occur with Intracranial Aneurysm.
Coma is a state of prolonged unconsciousness that can result from severe Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: CONFUSION
entities.description:
Confusion is a state of mental disorientation that can be a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.
Confusion is a symptom that can be associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: CRANIAL NERVE II
entities.description:
Cranial Nerve II is a localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.
Cranial Nerve II, also known as the optic nerve, is involved in vision and is a localization point related to Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: BRAIN
entities.description:
The Brain is a major localization area for Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Brain is the central organ of the nervous system and a major localization area for Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: OPTIC CHIASMA
entities.description:
The Optic Chiasma is a specific localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Optic Chiasma is the crossing of the optic nerves and is a localization point related to Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: PONS
entities.description:
The Pons is a localization area in the human body associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Pons is a part of the brainstem and a localization area associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: EXTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY
entities.description:
The External Carotid Artery supplies blood to the face and neck and is a localization point for Intracranial Aneurysm.
The External Carotid Artery is a localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: RADIAL ARTERY
entities.description:
The Radial Artery is a localization area in the human body associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Radial Artery is a major artery in the forearm and is a localization area related to Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: BRACHIOCEPHALIC ARTERY
entities.description:
The Brachiocephalic Artery is a major artery that supplies blood to the upper body and is a localization point for Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Brachiocephalic Artery is a localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: COMMON CAROTID ARTERY PLUS BRANCHES
entities.description:
The Common Carotid Artery Plus Branches is a localization area in the human body associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Common Carotid Artery and its branches supply blood to the head and neck and are localization areas for Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: INTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY
entities.description:
The Internal Carotid Artery is a localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.
The Internal Carotid Artery supplies blood to the brain and is a localization point for Intracranial Aneurysm.

entities.name: SUBCLAVIAN ARTERY
entities.description:
The Subclavian Artery supplies blood to the arms and is a localization area related to Intracranial Aneurysm.)<|COMPLETE|>
The Subclavian Artery is a localization area in the human body associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.

key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Blindness is the loss of vision, which can be a severe symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.Blindness is a symptom that can occur due to Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">EVENT</data>    </node>    <node id="BRAIN DEATH">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Brain Death is the irreversible loss of all functions of the brain, which can be a consequence of severe Intracranial Aneurysm.Brain Death is a severe outcome that can be associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">EVENT</data>    </node>    <node id="CEREBROSPINAL FLUID RHINORRHEA">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Cerebrospinal Fluid Rhinorrhea is a condition where cerebrospinal fluid leaks from the nose, which can be a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.Cerebrospinal Fluid Rhinorrhea is a symptom associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">EVENT</data>    </node>    <node id="COMA">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Coma is a serious symptom that can occur with Intracranial Aneurysm.Coma is a state of prolonged unconsciousness that can result from severe Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">EVENT</data>    </node>    <node id="CONFUSION">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Confusion is a state of mental disorientation that can be a symptom of Intracranial Aneurysm.Confusion is a symptom that can be associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">EVENT</data>    </node>    <node id="CRANIAL NERVE II">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">Cranial Nerve II is a localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.Cranial Nerve II, also known as the optic nerve, is involved in vision and is a localization point related to Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="BRAIN">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Brain is a major localization area for Intracranial Aneurysm.The Brain is the central organ of the nervous system and a major localization area for Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="OPTIC CHIASMA">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Optic Chiasma is a specific localization point in the human body related to Intracranial Aneurysm.The Optic Chiasma is the crossing of the optic nerves and is a localization point related to Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="PONS">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The Pons is a localization area in the human body associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.The Pons is a part of the brainstem and a localization area associated with Intracranial Aneurysm.</data>      <data key="d2">260ad12122b48fc74f1d315755e0c049</data>      <data key="d3">GEO</data>    </node>    <node id="EXTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY">      <data key="d0">GEO</data>      <data key="d1">The External      <data key="d1">The Brachiocephalic Artery is a major artery that supplies blood to the upper body and is a localization point for Intracranial Aneurysm.The Brachiocephalic Artery is a chunk:
[Lymphatic System Cancer] is the name of a kind of disease.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Lymphatic System Cancer.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Lymphatic System Cancer (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Carmustine
Pharmacologic class: Alkylating Activity
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Aphasia, Arrhythmia, Asthenia

Compound name: Teniposide
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Alopecia, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Anorexia, Arrhythmia, Asthenia, Bronchospasm, Chest pain, Infection

Compound name: Bleomycin
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Aggression, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Arteritis, Arthritis, Asthenia, Bronchospasm, Cerebral arteritis

Compound name: Methotrexate
Pharmacologic class: Folic Acid Metabolism Inhibitors
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Alveolitis allergic, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Aplastic anaemia, Anaemia megaloblastic, Anorexia

Compound name: Fludarabine
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Alopecia, Alveolitis allergic, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Autoimmune haemolytic anaemia, Aneurysm, Angina pectoris, Anorexia, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia

Compound name: Vincristine
Pharmacologic class: Vinca Alkaloids
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Acute abdomen, Abdominal cramps, Abdominal pain, Adrenal disorder, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Asthenia, Ataxia

Compound name: Mechlorethamine
Pharmacologic class: Alkylating Activity
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Haemolytic anaemia, Anorexia, Azoospermia, Blister, Skin cancer, Infection

Compound name: Cytarabine
Pharmacologic class: Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: 

Compound name: Mitoxantrone
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Lymphatic System Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia

chunk:
[Alcohol Dependence] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Agraphia].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Alcohol Amnestic Disorder].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Alkalosis, Respiratory].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Amblyopia].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Amnesia].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Asthenia].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Ataxia].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Auditory Perceptual Disorders].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Body Weight].
[Alcohol Dependence] presents the symptom [Bulimia].
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Parasympathetic Nervous System] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Blood] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Testis] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Brain] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Pons] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Gonad] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Digestive System] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Nervous System] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Central Nervous System] of human body.
[Alcohol Dependence] localizes at the [Nerve] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Alcohol Dependence.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Alcohol Dependence (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Chlordiazepoxide
Pharmacologic class: Benzodiazepines
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Palliate
Side effect: 

Compound name: Ondansetron
Pharmacologic class: Serotonin 3 Receptor Antagonists
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Palliate
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Anaphylactic shock, Angina pectoris, Angioedema, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Asthenia, Asthma, Atrial fibrillation, Bronchospasm

Compound name: Citalopram
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal cramps, Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abortion spontaneous, Abscess, Aggression, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea

Compound name: Acamprosate
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Alcoholism, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris

Compound name: Naltrexone
Pharmacologic class: Opioid Antagonists
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal cramps, Abdominal pain, Abortion missed, Pancreatitis acute, Alcoholism, Alopecia, Dementia Alzheimer's type, Anaphylactic shock, Angina pectoris, Angina unstable

Compound name: Disulfiram
Pharmacologic class: Acetyl Aldehyde Dehydrogenase Inhibitors
Effect on Alcohol Dependence: Treat
Side effect: Asthenia, Dermatitis atopic, Dizziness, Drowsiness, Rash, Fatigue, Breath odour, Headache, Hepatitis, Hypoaesthesia

entities.name: ALCOHOL DEPENDENCE
entities.description: Alcohol Dependence is a disease characterized by a range of symptoms affecting various systems in the body, including the nervous system and digestive system.

entities.name: AGRAPHIA
entities.description: Agraphia is a symptom associated with Alcohol Dependence, indicating a loss of the ability to write.

entities.name: ALCOHOL AMNESTIC DISORDER
entities.description: Alcohol Amnestic Disorder is a symptom of Alcohol Dependence that involves memory loss related to alcohol use.

entities.name: ALKALOSIS, RESPIRATORY
entities.description: Respiratory Alkalosis is a symptom of Alcohol Dependence that affects the body's acid-base balance.

entities.name: AMBYLOPIA
entities.description: Amblyopia is a visual disorder that can be a symptom of Alcohol Dependence.

entities.name: AMNESIA
entities.description: Amnesia is a symptom of Alcohol Dependence characterized by memory loss.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description: Asthenia is a symptom of Alcohol Dependence that refers to a lack of energy or strength.

entities.name: ATAXIA
entities.description: Ataxia is a symptom of Alcohol Dependence that affects coordination and balance.

entities.name: AUDITORY PERCEPTUAL DISORDERS
entities.description: Auditory Perceptual Disorders are symptoms of Alcohol Dependence that affect the processing of auditory information.

entities.name: BODY WEIGHT
entities.description: Changes in Body Weight can be a symptom of Alcohol Dependence.

entities.name: BULIMIA
entities.description: Bulimia is a potential symptom associated with Alcohol Dependence, involving episodes of binge eating.

entities.name: PARASYMPATHETIC NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Parasympathetic Nervous System is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: BLOOD
entities.description: Blood is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: TESTIS
entities.description: The Testis is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: BRAIN
entities.description: The Brain is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: PONS
entities.description: The Pons is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: GONAD
entities.description: The Gonad is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: DIGESTIVE SYSTEM
entities.description: The Digestive System is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Nervous System is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM
entities.description: The Central Nervous System is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: NERVE
entities.description: The Nerve is one of the locations in the body where Alcohol Dependence localizes its effects.

entities.name: CHLORDIAZEPOXIDE
entities.description: Chlordiazepoxide is a benzodiazepine compound that can palliate the symptoms of Alcohol Dependence.

entities.name: ONDANSETRON
entities.description: Ondansetron is a serotonin 3 receptor antagonist that can palliate the symptoms of Alcohol Dependence, but has several side effects.

entities.name: CITALOPRAM
entities.description: Citalopram is a compound that treats Alcohol Dependence and has various side effects.

entities.name: ACAMPROSATE
entities.description: Acamprosate is a compound that treats Alcohol Dependence and has various side effects.

entities.name: NALTREXONE
entities.description: Naltrexone is an opioid antagonist that treats Alcohol Dependence and has various side effects.

entities.name: DISULFIRAM
entities.description: Disulfiram is an acetyl aldehyde dehydrogenase inhibitor that treats Alcohol Dependence and has various side effects.

[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Edema].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Hypesthesia].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Pupil Disorders].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Vision Disorders].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Vision, Low].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Pseudophakia].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] presents the symptom [Mobility Limitation].
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] localizes at the [Cornea] of human body.
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] localizes at the [Corneal Epithelium] of human body.
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] localizes at the [Substantia Propria Of Cornea] of human body.
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] localizes at the [Aqueous Humor Of Eyeball] of human body.
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] localizes at the [Corneal Endothelium] of human body.
[Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy] localizes at the [Endothelium] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

entities.name: FUCHS' ENDOTHELIAL DYSTROPHY
entities.description: Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy is a disease characterized by various symptoms affecting the cornea and vision.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a symptom associated with Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, indicating swelling due to fluid accumulation.

entities.name: HYPESTHESIA
entities.description: Hypesthesia is a symptom of Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, referring to reduced sensitivity to stimulation.

entities.name: PUPIL DISORDERS
entities.description: Pupil Disorders are symptoms related to Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, affecting the function of the pupils.

entities.name: VISION DISORDERS
entities.description: Vision Disorders are symptoms of Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy that impact visual acuity and perception.

entities.name: VISION, LOW
entities.description: Low Vision is a symptom of Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, indicating a significant reduction in visual capability.

entities.name: PSEUDOPHAKIA
entities.description: Pseudophakia is a symptom associated with Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, often related to the presence of an artificial lens.

entities.name: MOBILITY LIMITATION
entities.description: Mobility Limitation is a symptom of Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, affecting the ability to move freely.

entities.name: CORNEA
entities.description: The Cornea is a part of the human body where Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy localizes, affecting its structure and function.

entities.name: CORNEAL EPITHELIUM
entities.description: The Corneal Epithelium is a layer of the cornea that is impacted by Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy.

entities.name: SUBSTANTIA PROPRIA OF CORNEA
entities.description: The Substantia Propria of the Cornea is a layer that can be affected by Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy.

entities.name: AQUEOUS HUMOR OF EYEBALL
entities.description: The Aqueous Humor of the Eyeball is a fluid that can be influenced by Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy.

entities.name: CORNEAL ENDOTHELIUM
entities.description: The Corneal Endothelium is a layer of cells in the cornea that is primarily affected by Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy.

entities.name: ENDOTHELIUM
entities.description: The Endothelium is a tissue layer that can be impacted by Fuchs' Endothelial Dystrophy, particularly in the cornea.)("relationship"

[Ureter Cancer] presents the symptom [Pain].
[Ureter Cancer] presents the symptom [Flank Pain].
[Ureter Cancer] presents the symptom [Urinoma].
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Ureter] of human body.
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Urethra] of human body.
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Ejaculatory Duct] of human body.
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Renal System] of human body.
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Urine] of human body.
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Renal Pelvis] of human body.
[Ureter Cancer] localizes at the [Nephron] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Ureter Cancer.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Ureter Cancer: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Ureter Cancer (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

entities.name: URETER CANCER
entities.description: Ureter Cancer is a type of disease that affects the ureter and can present various symptoms such as colic, pain, flank pain, and urinoma.

entities.name: COLIC
entities.description: Colic is a symptom associated with Ureter Cancer characterized by severe, often fluctuating pain in the abdomen.

entities.name: PAIN
entities.description: Pain is a common symptom of Ureter Cancer, indicating discomfort or distress in the body.

entities.name: FLANK PAIN
entities.description: Flank Pain is a specific type of pain that occurs in the side of the body, often associated with Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: URINOMA
entities.description: Urinoma is a symptom of Ureter Cancer that refers to a collection of urine outside the urinary tract.

entities.name: URETER
entities.description: The Ureter is a duct that carries urine from the kidney to the bladder and is one of the locations affected by Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: URETHRA
entities.description: The Urethra is the tube that carries urine from the bladder to the outside of the body and is also affected by Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: EJACULATORY DUCT
entities.description: The Ejaculatory Duct is a duct in the male reproductive system that can be affected by Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: RENAL SYSTEM
entities.description: The Renal System is the organ system that regulates the composition of blood and produces urine, and is involved in Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: URINE
entities.description: Urine is the liquid waste product of the body that is produced by the kidneys and can be affected by Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: RENAL PELVIS
entities.description: The Renal Pelvis is the area of the kidney where urine collects before moving to the ureter, and is affected by Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: NEPHRON
entities.description: The Nephron is the functional unit of the kidney that filters blood and produces urine, and can be involved in Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: KIDNEY
entities.description: The Kidney is an organ that filters waste from the blood and produces urine, and is affected by Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: PHARMACOLOGIC CLASS
entities.description: Pharmacologic class refers to the category of drugs that share similar chemical characteristics and effects, relevant to the treatment of Ureter Cancer.

entities.name: EFFECT ON URETER CANCER
entities.description: Effect on Ureter Cancer describes whether a compound can palliate or treat the disease.

entities.name: SIDE EFFECT
entities.description: Side effect refers to any unintended effects that a compound may have when used to treat Ureter Cancer.)<|COMPLETE|>

entities.name: VAGINAL CANCER
entities.description: Vaginal Cancer is a type of disease characterized by various symptoms and localizations in the human body.

entities.name: AGEUSIA
entities.description: Ageusia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating a loss of taste sensation.

entities.name: AGNOSIA
entities.description: Agnosia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating an inability to recognize objects or people.

entities.name: AMBYLOPIA
entities.description: Amblyopia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, often referred to as "lazy eye," affecting vision.

entities.name: ANOREXIA
entities.description: Anorexia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, characterized by a loss of appetite.

entities.name: OLFACATION DISORDERS
entities.description: Olfaction Disorders are symptoms associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating issues with the sense of smell.

entities.name: ANOXIA
entities.description: Anoxia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating a deficiency in the amount of oxygen reaching the tissues.

entities.name: APHASIA
entities.description: Aphasia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating a loss of ability to understand or express speech.

entities.name: APHASIA, WERNICKE
entities.description: Wernicke's Aphasia is a specific type of aphasia associated with Vaginal Cancer, affecting language comprehension.

entities.name: APHONIA
entities.description: Aphonia is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating a loss of voice or ability to speak.

entities.name: APNEA
entities.description: Apnea is a symptom associated with Vaginal Cancer, indicating temporary cessation of breathing.

chunk:
Side effect: Abscess, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Asthenia

Compound name: Fluorouracil
Pharmacologic class: Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors
Effect on Vaginal Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Congenital anomaly, Abortion spontaneous, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia, Arrhythmia

entities.name: FLUOROURACIL
entities.description: Fluorouracil is a medication used in the treatment of various cancers, including vaginal cancer, and belongs to the pharmacologic class of Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors.

entities.name: VAGINAL CANCER
entities.description: Vaginal cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the tissues of the vagina and is treated with medications like Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ANAEMIA
entities.description: Anaemia is a condition characterized by a deficiency of red cells or hemoglobin in the blood, which can occur as a side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a condition that results in hair loss and can be a side effect of treatments like Fluorouracil.

entities.name: AMNESIA
entities.description: Amnesia is a form of memory loss that can occur as a side effect of certain medications, including Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ANAPHYLACTIC SHOCK
entities.description: Anaphylactic shock is a severe allergic reaction that can be a rare side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ARRHYTHMIA
entities.description: Arrhythmia is an irregular heartbeat that can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description: Asthenia is a condition of physical weakness that can occur as a side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: HAEMOLYTIC ANAEMIA
entities.description: Haemolytic anaemia is a condition where red blood cells are destroyed faster than they can be made, which can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ANOREXIA
entities.description: Anorexia is a loss of appetite that can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: CONGENITAL ANOMALY
entities.description: Congenital anomaly refers to a condition present at birth that can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.

entities.name: ABORTION SPONTANEOUS
entities.description: Spontaneous abortion, or miscarriage, can be a potential side effect associated with Fluorouracil.

entities.name: AGRANULOCYTOSIS
entities.description: Agranulocytosis is a potentially severe side effect of Fluorouracil characterized by a dangerously low level of neutrophils in the blood.

condition of physical weakness that can occur as a side effect of Fluorouracil.</data>      <data key="d2">63da78bf4a3570a7f3d8a9f3e43769b3</data>    </node>    <node id="HAEMOLYTIC ANAEMIA">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Haemolytic anaemia is a condition where red blood cells are destroyed faster than they can be made, which can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.</data>      <data key="d2">63da78bf4a3570a7f3d8a9f3e43769b3</data>    </node>    <node id="ANOREXIA">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Anorexia is a loss of appetite that can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.</data>      <data key="d2">63da78bf4a3570a7f3d8a9f3e43769b3</data>    </node>    <node id="CONGENITAL ANOMALY">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Congenital anomaly refers to a condition present at birth that can be a side effect of Fluorouracil.</data>      <data key="d2">63da78bf4a3570a7f3d8a9f3e43769b3</data>    </node>    <node id="ABORTION SPONTANEOUS">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Spontaneous abortion, or miscarriage, can be a potential side effect associated with Fluorouracil.</data>      <data key="d2">63da78bf4a3570a7f3d8a9f3e43769b3</data>    </node>    <node id="AGRANULOCYTOSIS">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Agranulocytosis is a potentially severe side effect of Fluorouracil characterized by a dangerously low level of neutrophils in the blood.</data>      <data key="d2">63da78bf4a3570a7f3d8a9f3e43769b3</data>    </node>    <node id="ANXIETY">      <data [Osteoporosis] is the name of a kind of disease.
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Asthenia].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Back Pain].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Body Weight].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Edema].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Emaciation].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Hemiplegia].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Menkes Kinky Hair Syndrome].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Monoclonal Gammopathy Of Undetermined Significance].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Muscular Atrophy].
[Osteoporosis] presents the symptom [Pain].
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Uterus] of human body.
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Vertebral Column] of human body.
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Parathyroid Gland] of human body.
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Sciatic Nerve] of human body.
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Epiphysis] of human body.
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Hip] of human body.

[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Mandible] of human body.
[Osteoporosis] localizes at the [Jaw Skeleton] of human body.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Osteoporosis.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Osteoporosis: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Osteoporosis (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Oxandrolone
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Osteoporosis: Palliate
Side effect: Azoospermia, Oedema, Epididymitis, Gynaecomastia, Haemorrhage, Hirsutism, Irritability, Jaundice cholestatic, Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, Necrosis

Compound name: Zoledronate
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Acute phase reaction, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angioedema, Anorexia, Anxiety

Compound name: Cholecalciferol
Pharmacologic class: Vitamin D
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: 

Compound name: Conjugated Estrogens
Pharmacologic class: Estrogen Receptor Agonists
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal cramps, Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Acidosis, Alkalosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Angioedema

Compound name: Risedronate
Pharmacologic class: Diphosphonates
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Acute phase reaction, Amblyopia, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Angioedema, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia

Compound name: Ibandronate
Pharmacologic class: Diphosphonates
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Acute phase reaction, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angioedema, Anxiety, Arthralgia, Arthritis

Compound name: Alendronate
Pharmacologic class: Diphosphonates
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Acute phase reaction, Alopecia, Anaemia, Angioedema, Asthenia, Asthma, Chest pain, Infection

Compound name: Ethinyl Estradiol
Pharmacologic class: Estrogen Receptor Agonists
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Angioedema, Anxiety, Asthenia, Back pain, Mental disorder, Breast disorder

Compound name: Calcium Acetate
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abscess, Acidosis, Anorexia, Arrhythmia, Asthenia, Calcinosis, Coma, Confusional state, Constipation, Delirium

Compound name: Estropipate
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal cramps, Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock, Angioedema, Anxiety, Arthralgia, Asthenia

Compound name: Raloxifene
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Osteoporosis: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Arthralgia, Arthritis, Bladder cancer, Breast disorder, Bronchitis, Ne

entities.name: OSTEOPOROSIS
entities.description: Osteoporosis is a disease characterized by a decrease in bone density, leading to an increased risk of fractures and other complications.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description: Asthenia is a symptom associated with osteoporosis, characterized by a lack of energy and strength.

entities.name: BACK PAIN
entities.description: Back pain is a common symptom of osteoporosis, often resulting from fractures or changes in the spine.

entities.name: BODY WEIGHT
entities.description: Body weight changes can be a symptom of osteoporosis, as the disease may affect overall health and mobility.

entities.name: EDEMA
entities.description: Edema is a symptom that can occur in patients with osteoporosis, indicating fluid retention in the body.

entities.name: EMACIATION
entities.description: Emaciation is a severe symptom that may be associated with osteoporosis, reflecting significant weight loss and malnutrition.

entities.name: HEMIPLEGIA
entities.description: Hemiplegia is a condition that may occur in severe cases of osteoporosis, leading to paralysis on one side of the body.

entities.name: MENKES KINKY HAIR SYNDROME
entities.description: Menkes Kinky Hair Syndrome is a genetic disorder that may present symptoms similar to those of osteoporosis.

entities.name: MONOCLONAL GAMMOPATHY OF UNDETERMINED SIGNIFICANCE
entities.description: Monoclonal Gammopathy of Undetermined Significance is a condition that can be associated with osteoporosis and may affect bone health.

entities.name: MUSCULAR ATROPHY
entities.description: Muscular atrophy is a symptom that can occur in individuals with osteoporosis due to decreased mobility and physical activity.

entities.name: PAIN
entities.description: Pain is a general symptom associated with osteoporosis, often resulting from fractures or bone weakening.

entities.name: UTERUS
entities.description: The uterus is one of the locations in the human body where osteoporosis can have an impact, particularly in postmenopausal women.

entities.name: VERTEBRAL COLUMN
entities.description: The vertebral column is a critical area affected by osteoporosis, where fractures can lead to significant complications.

entities.name: PARATHYROID GLAND
entities.description: The parathyroid gland is involved in calcium regulation and can be affected by osteoporosis.

entities.name: SCIATIC NERVE
entities.description: The sciatic nerve may be impacted by osteoporosis-related conditions, leading to pain and mobility issues.

entities.name: EPIPHYSIS
entities.description: The epiphysis is a part of the bone structure that can be affected by osteoporosis, particularly in joint areas.

entities.name: HIP
entities.description: The hip is a common site for fractures in individuals with osteoporosis, leading to significant health risks.

entities.name: HIP JOINT
entities.description: The hip joint is a critical area where osteoporosis can lead to fractures and mobility issues.

entities.name: MANDIBLE
entities.description: The mandible is a bone that can be affected by osteoporosis, leading to dental and structural issues.

entities.name: JAW SKELETON
entities.description: The jaw skeleton is another area where osteoporosis can have effects, particularly in older adults.

entities.name: LOWER JAW REGION
entities.description:
The lower jaw region can be impacted by osteoporosis, affecting dental health and bone integrity.)<|COMPLETE|>
The lower jaw region can be impacted by osteoporosis, affecting dental health and bone integrity.

entities.name: OXANDROLONE
entities.description: Oxandrolone is a compound that can palliate osteoporosis but has several side effects including azoospermia and hirsutism.

entities.name: ZOLEDRONATE
entities.description: Zoledronate is a compound used to treat osteoporosis, associated with side effects like abdominal pain and anaphylactic shock.

entities.name: CHOLECALCIFEROL
entities.description: Cholecalciferol is a vitamin D compound that treats osteoporosis, promoting calcium absorption.

entities.name: CONJUGATED ESTROGENS
entities.description: Conjugated estrogens are estrogen receptor agonists used to treat osteoporosis, with side effects including abdominal cramps and anaphylactic shock.

entities.name: RISEDRONATE
entities.description: Risedronate is a diphosphonate compound that treats osteoporosis, with side effects like abdominal pain and anxiety.

entities.name: IBANDRONATE
entities.description: Ibandronate is a diphosphonate used to treat osteoporosis, associated with side effects like abdominal pain and anxiety.

entities.name: ALENDRONATE
entities.description: Alendronate is a diphosphonate that treats osteoporosis, with side effects including abdominal pain and asthma.

entities.name: ETHINYL ESTRADIOL
entities.description: Ethinyl estradiol is an estrogen receptor agonist used to treat osteoporosis, with side effects like abdominal pain and anxiety.

entities.name: CALCIUM ACETATE
entities.description: Calcium acetate is a compound that treats osteoporosis, with side effects including arrhythmia and confusion.

entities.name: ESTROPIPATE
entities.description: Estropipate is a compound that treats osteoporosis, with side effects including abdominal cramps and anxiety.

entities.name: RALOXIFENE
entities.description: Raloxifene is a compound that treats osteoporosis, with side effects including abdominal pain and arthritis.

entities.name: RALOXIFENE
entities.description: Raloxifene is a compound used to treat osteoporosis and is associated with various side effects including abdominal pain and arthralgia.

entities.name: OSTEOPOROSIS
entities.description: Osteoporosis is a medical condition that Raloxifene is used to treat.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL CRAMPS
entities.description: Abdominal cramps are a side effect associated with Raloxifene.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL DISTENSION
entities.description:
Abdominal distension is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.
Abdominal distension is a condition characterized by an increase in the size of the abdomen, which can be a side effect of medications like Raloxifene.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description:
Abdominal pain is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.
Abdominal pain is a common symptom that can be associated with various medical conditions and is noted as a side effect of Raloxifene.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description:
Alopecia refers to hair loss, which can be a side effect of certain medications, including Raloxifene.
Alopecia is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description:
Amenorrhoea is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.
Amenorrhoea is the absence of menstruation, which can occur as a side effect of Raloxifene.

entities.name: ANAPHYLACTIC SHOCK
entities.description:
Anaphylactic shock is a severe allergic reaction that can occur as a side effect of medications like Raloxifene.
Anaphylactic shock is a severe side effect associated with Raloxifene.

entities.name: ANGIOEDEMA
entities.description:
Angioedema is a condition characterized by swelling beneath the skin, which can be a side effect of Raloxifene.
Angioedema is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.

entities.name: ANXIETY
entities.description:
Anxiety is a psychological condition that can be exacerbated by certain medications, including Raloxifene.
Anxiety is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.

entities.name: ARTHRALGIA
entities.description:
Arthralgia refers to joint pain, which can be a side effect of Raloxifene.
Arthralgia is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description:
Asthenia is a side effect associated with Raloxifene.
Asthenia is a condition characterized by a lack of energy and strength, which can be a side effect of Raloxifene.

The following content describes information about compounds that can palliate or treat the disease named Urinary Bladder Cancer.The format of each compound's information is as follows:
Compound name: ***
Pharmacologic class: ***
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Palliate or Treat
Side effect: ***
These respectively represent the name of the compound, the pharmacologic class it belongs to, its positive effect on the disease named Urinary Bladder Cancer (palliates or treats) and its side effects.

Compound name: Mitomycin
Pharmacologic class: Alkylating Activity
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Alopecia, Anaemia, Anorexia, Asthenia, Confusional state, Cough, Dermatitis, Diarrhoea, Dizziness, Drowsiness

Compound name: Valrubicin
Pharmacologic class: None
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Anaemia, Asthenia, Back pain, Chest pain, Cystitis, Dermatitis, Diarrhoea, Dizziness, Dysuria

Compound name: Gemcitabine
Pharmacologic class: Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Traffic accident, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia, Asthenia, Azoospermia

Compound name: Carboplatin
Pharmacologic class: Platinum-containing Compounds
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Infection, Extravasation, Body temperature increased, Pain, Phlebitis, Venous thrombosis, Fluid overload

Compound name: Fluorouracil
Pharmacologic class: Nucleic Acid Synthesis Inhibitors
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Congenital anomaly, Abortion spontaneous, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Angina pectoris, Anorexia, Arrhythmia

Compound name: Cisplatin
Pharmacologic class: Platinum-containing Compounds
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abscess, Alopecia, Amnesia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Haemolytic anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Asthenia

Compound name: Methotrexate
Pharmacologic class: Folic Acid Metabolism Inhibitors
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Abscess, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Alveolitis allergic, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Aplastic anaemia, Anaemia megaloblastic, Anorexia

Compound name: Etoposide
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Anaphylactic shock, Anaemia, Anorexia, Apnoea, Ascites, Asthenia, Back pain

Compound name: Thiotepa
Pharmacologic class: Alkylating Activity
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia, Asthenia

Compound name: Doxorubicin
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Lactic acidosis, Agranulocytosis, Album

pain, Agranulocytosis, Alopecia, Amenorrhoea, Anaemia, Anorexia, Anxiety, Arrhythmia, Arthralgia, Asthenia

Compound name: Doxorubicin
Pharmacologic class: Topoisomerase Inhibitors
Effect on Urinary Bladder Cancer: Treat
Side effect: Abdominal distension, Abdominal pain, Abscess, Lactic acidosis, Agranulocytosis, Albuminuria, Alopecia, Amblyopia, Amenorrhoea, Anaphylactic shock

entities.name: DOXORUBICIN
entities.description: Doxorubicin is a topoisomerase inhibitor used in the treatment of urinary bladder cancer, known for its various side effects.

entities.name: URINARY BLADDER CANCER
entities.description: Urinary bladder cancer is a type of cancer that Doxorubicin is used to treat.

entities.name: AGRANULOCYTOSIS
entities.description: Agranulocytosis is a serious side effect associated with Doxorubicin treatment, characterized by a dangerously low level of neutrophils.

entities.name: ALOPECIA
entities.description: Alopecia is a side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, leading to hair loss.

entities.name: AMENORRHOEA
entities.description: Amenorrhoea is a side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, resulting in the absence of menstruation.

entities.name: ANXIETY
entities.description: Anxiety is a potential side effect experienced by patients undergoing treatment with Doxorubicin.

entities.name: ARRHYTHMIA
entities.description: Arrhythmia is a possible side effect of Doxorubicin, affecting heart rhythm.

entities.name: ASTHENIA
entities.description: Asthenia is a side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, characterized by weakness and fatigue.

entities.name: ABDOMINAL PAIN
entities.description: Abdominal pain is a side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, causing discomfort in the abdominal area.

entities.name: ABSCESS
entities.description: An abscess is a potential side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, involving a collection of pus that can occur in various body parts.

entities.name: LACTIC ACIDOSIS
entities.description: Lactic acidosis is a serious side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, characterized by the buildup of lactic acid in the body.

entities.name: ALBUMINURIA
entities.description: Albuminuria is a side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, indicating the presence of albumin in urine, which can signal kidney issues.

entities.name: AMBLYOPIA
entities.description: Amblyopia is a potential side effect of Doxorubicin treatment, leading to reduced vision in one eye.
